H0.text: Seasonal changes are a result of the tilt of Earth's axis.

H1.text: Hours in a day are a result of the tilt of Earth's axis.

H2.text: Heights of tides are a result of the tilt of Earth's axis.

H3.text: Moon phases are a result of the tilt of Earth's axis.

A4.text: Earth's axis remains tilted in the same direction with reference to the background stars throughout a year â€“ this is known as axial parallelism. This means that one pole (and the associated hemisphere of Earth) will be directed away from the Sun at one side of the orbit, and half an orbit later this pole will be directed towards the Sun.
